333R/A0/08/200/202.indicator_name: 2. # of COs reporting data and qualitative analysis on OOSC and children at risk of exclusion (in pre-primary  primary and secondary education)

Partially achieved. 18 COs reporting work for Intercultural bilingual education (for indigenous children) in 2013.  None of them reports reduction in gaps. However  some COs (e.g. Peru and Guatemala) report improvement in targeted areas.
333R/A0/08/200/202.indicator_name: 3. # of COs with a focus on inclusive education for children with disabilities and in Intercultural bilingual education  reporting progress towards shortening the gap along the education cycle

333R/A0/08/200/203.indicator_name: 1. # of countries with national plans/strategies for HIV prevention among young key affected populations (YKAP)

333R/A0/08/200/203.status_value: No updated data available as of end of 2013  since the 2013 UNAIDS JPMS report for 2013 is not yet published.   Also  the Elimination Initiative report is being completed for 2013.
333R/A0/08/200/203.indicator_name: 2. # of countries reporting increased HIV-related knowledge among adolescents

333R/A0/08/200/203.status_value: No updated data available as of end of 2013  since the 2013 UNAIDS JPMS report for 2013 is not yet published.    However  most countries are using Long life Therapy for the health of the mother and to prevent HIV vertical transmission. It is observed an increase in the number of pregnant women getting ART (80%) in 24 countries in 2013.  Also  % of pregnant women receiving ART in the region increased from 73% in 2011 to 88% in 2012.
333R/A0/08/200/203.indicator_name: 3. # of countries reporting increased number of pregnant women receiving ART

333R/A0/08/200/203.status_value: No updated data available as of end of 2013  since the 2013 UNAIDS JPMS report for 2013 is not yet published.   However  24 countries reported to have a notional policy and guidelines consistent with international standard for EMTCT and to keep mothers alive.
333R/A0/08/200/203.indicator_name: 4. # of countries reporting increased percentage of pregnant women tested for HIV

333R/A0/08/200/203.status_value: No updated data available as of end of 2013  since the 2013 UNAIDS JJPMS report for 2013 is not yet published.    There is a drop by 24% in LA and 32% in the Caribbean between 2009 and 2011.    24 countries have the capacity to provide virologic HIV testing for infants.
333R/A0/08/200/203.indicator_name: 5. # of countries reporting increased percentage of children receiving ARV prophylaxis

333R/A0/08/200/203.status_value: Achieved.  6 COs (Argentina  Brazil  Colombia  Guatemala  Panama and Uruguay) and 3 in the Caribbean (DR  Haiti and Jamaica) strengthened interventions for Adolescents living with HIV.
333R/A0/08/200/203.indicator_name: 6. # of country offices scaling-up interventions for adolescents living with HIV

333R/A0/08/200/203.status_value: Not achieved. No new initiatives which implement AIDS related social protection policies in the region.
333R/A0/08/200/203.indicator_name: 7. # of countries with/implementing AIDS-related social protection policies

333R/A0/08/800/001.status_value: Achieved. A total of 25 missions to COs completed for 2012-2013 to provide oversight and technical support in operations and ICT. The scope included audit preparations  CPMP process  and general operations and ICT issues. Monthly monitoring of performance indicators implemented.
333R/A0/08/800/001.indicator_name: 1. # of oversight and support missions carried out by RO staff

333R/A0/08/800/001.status_value: Achieved. Two operations hubs (Panama and Argentina) were full operational by the end of 2013 supporting 7 COs as per the 2011 PBR decision.  Service Level Agreement between the Hub and the participating COs were signed and implemented.
333R/A0/08/800/001.indicator_name: 2. # of cost-effective shared operations services functioning in LAC.

333R/A0/08/800/001.status_value: Achieved.  Annual savings in staff costs reached about $84 000 from the 3 new COs which joined hubs in 2013. These savings were retained by the COs and utilised either to support operating costs or fund other core functions. Operating costs will continue to be monitored in 2014 to see if reductions were also achieved.
333R/A0/08/800/001.indicator_name: 3. Saving for COs (Belize  Venezuela  Panama and Paraguay) on operating staff and costs as a result of shared services.

333R/A0/08/800/001.status_value: Achieved. Operations processes of 5 COs (Barbados  Guatemala  Belize  Paraguay  Venezuela) were reviewed either during onsite visits to COs or as preparatory work for their joining the Hub.  Bilateral discussions on country-specific issues were also held during the RMT and Operations Managers' annual meetings. Also supported one CO (Ecuador) in preparing for its transition to the Hub in 2014.
333R/A0/08/800/001.indicator_name: 4. # of LAC offices supported in their internal work process reviewed.

333R/A0/08/800/001.status_value: Constrained.   While RO provided regular advice to COs  the documentation of efficiency gains continued to be a challenge.  RO will explore the opportunity to develop guidance in this area in 2014.
333R/A0/08/800/001.indicator_name: 5.# of COs that have documented efficiency gains in their operations functions

333R/A0/08/800/001.status_value: Achieved. A total of 4 staff strained (2 staff in 2012 and 2 others in 2013).  With this  all ICT staff (100%) in the region had achieved the relevant certifications.
333R/A0/08/800/001.indicator_name: 6. # of ICT staff in COs with appropriate certification on their skills.

333R/A0/08/800/001.status_value: Achieved. All 24 CO are MOSS compliant based on the CO information provided and checked during Reg. Chief ICT missions.
